abstract: Visa is introducing a system that lets customers wave specially equipped cellphones in the checkout aisle to charge purchases.
snippet: Visa is introducing a system that lets customers wave specially equipped cellphones in the checkout aisle to charge purchases.
lead_paragraph: I wrote last week about a way to make your cellphone work like a credit card by applying a sticker to the back. The sticker, equipped with a radio frequency identification, or R.F.I.D., tag lets you wave the phone over a terminal to make a purchase.

headline.main: Visa Introduces a Credit Card on a Phone
